title: üü† Implement MAIP (Multi-Authoring in Public) Foundation
body:
## Vision: Multi-Authoring in Public (MAIP)
Revolutionary collaborative writing system where multiple authors work together in real-time on the blockchain, with every contribution tracked and rewarded through micropayments.

## Current Foundation in Bitcoin Marketing
Bitcoin Marketing already has key components that make MAIP possible:

### ‚úÖ Existing Infrastructure
- **Document Versioning**: Git-style version control with WorkTree visualization
- **Blockchain Publishing**: Documents stored on BSV blockchain
- **User Authentication**: HandCash integration for payments
- **Real-time Editing**: Document editor with auto-save
- **Content Tracking**: Word/character counts, edit history

### ‚úÖ Recent Enhancements  
- **Document Persistence**: Users can access published documents across sessions
- **Protocol Integration**: Foundation for B://, D://, Bcat protocols
- **Version Management**: HEAD pointers and checkout functionality

## MAIP Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Collaborative Infrastructure (Week 1-2)
**Goal**: Enable multiple authors to work on the same document

#### Technical Components:
```typescript
interface MAIPDocument {
  id: string;
  title: string;
  collaborators: string[];
  permissions: CollaboratorPermissions;
  bountyPool: number; // BSV satoshis
  contributionTracking: ContributionEntry[];
}

interface ContributionEntry {
  author: string;
  timestamp: string;
  changeType: 'addition' | 'deletion' | 'modification';
  content: string;
  valueScore: number; // AI-calculated contribution value
  payment: number; // BSV satoshis earned
}
```

#### Features:
- Document invitation system via D:// URLs
- Real-time collaborative editing (operational transforms)
- Contribution tracking per character/word
- Initial bounty pool setup by document creator

### Phase 2: Value Attribution System (Week 3-4)
**Goal**: AI-powered assessment of contribution value

#### AI Valuation Engine:
- **Quality Metrics**: Grammar improvements, clarity, factual accuracy
- **Originality**: New content vs. edits vs. deletions
- **Impact**: Readability improvements, structural enhancements
- **Peer Review**: Other collaborators can rate contributions

#### Smart Contracts:
```typescript
class MAIPContract {
  async trackContribution(author: string, changes: DocumentChange[]): Promise<number>
  async calculateValue(contribution: ContributionEntry): Promise<number>
  async distributeBounty(contributions: ContributionEntry[]): Promise<PaymentResult[]>
}
```

### Phase 3: Real-time Economy (Week 5-6)
**Goal**: Instant micropayments for valuable contributions

#### Payment System:
- Automatic BSV micropayments for each contribution
- Reader payments flowing to all contributors proportionally
- Quality bonuses for high-value additions
- Reputation staking system

#### Economics:
```typescript
interface MAIPEconomics {
  initiationBounty: number; // Creator stakes BSV to attract contributors
  readerPayments: number; // Per-read micropayments
  qualityMultipliers: { [key: string]: number }; // Bonus for excellent work
  reputationStaking: number; // Authors stake reputation tokens
}
```

### Phase 4: Public Collaboration (Week 7-8)  
**Goal**: Open documents that anyone can improve

#### Public Document Types:
- **Academic Papers**: Researchers collaborate globally with peer review
- **News Articles**: Journalists add facts/perspectives from different regions
- **Technical Docs**: Developers improve documentation together
- **Creative Writing**: Stories evolving through collective imagination

#### Discovery & Sharing:
- Public document directory
- Tag-based categorization
- Contribution leaderboards
- Quality-based ranking

## Integration with Existing Bitcoin Marketing

### DocumentEditor Enhancements
```typescript
// Add collaboration features
const [collaborators, setCollaborators] = useState<string[]>([]);
const [contributionMode, setContributionMode] = useState<'solo' | 'maip'>('solo');
const [realtimeEdits, setRealtimeEdits] = useState<EditEvent[]>([]);

// Track contributions in real-time
const trackContribution = (changes: DocumentChange[]) => {
  changes.forEach(change => {
    const contribution: ContributionEntry = {
      author: currentUser.handle,
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
      changeType: detectChangeType(change),
      content: change.text,
      valueScore: 0, // To be calculated by AI
      payment: 0 // To be distributed from bounty pool
    };
    
    maipService.trackContribution(contribution);
  });
};
```

### DocumentSidebar MAIP Indicators
- üë• Show collaborative documents
- üí∞ Display bounty pools and earnings
- üìä Contribution statistics per document
- üèÜ Reputation scores

### Version Control Integration
- MAIP documents use git-style branching
- Contributors work on feature branches
- Merge conflicts resolved through voting
- All contributions preserved in blockchain history

## Technical Architecture

### Backend Services
```typescript
class MAIPService {
  async createCollaborativeDocument(bounty: number): Promise<MAIPDocument>
  async inviteCollaborator(docId: string, userHandle: string): Promise<void>
  async trackRealTimeEdits(docId: string, edits: EditEvent[]): Promise<void>
  async calculateContributionValue(contribution: ContributionEntry): Promise<number>
  async distributeBountyPayments(docId: string): Promise<PaymentResult[]>
}

class RealtimeCollaboration {
  async syncEdits(docId: string, operation: Operation): Promise<void>
  async resolveConflicts(conflicts: Conflict[]): Promise<Resolution>
  async broadcastChanges(docId: string, changes: DocumentChange[]): Promise<void>
}
```

### Blockchain Integration
- Document state stored using D:// protocol (mutable references)
- Individual contributions stored as B:// transactions
- Payment history immutable on blockchain
- Reputation system using blockchain-based tokens

## Revolutionary Use Cases

### Academic Research
- Global collaboration on research papers
- Real-time peer review with compensation
- Citation tracking and credit attribution
- Multi-institutional authorship

### Journalism
- Breaking news with multiple correspondents
- Fact-checking crowdsourcing
- Regional perspective integration
- Real-time corrections and updates

### Open Source Documentation
- Developer documentation improvement
- Tutorial creation and enhancement
- Code example contributions
- Multi-language translations

### Creative Collaboration
- Collaborative storytelling
- Screenplay development
- Poetry and artistic writing
- Community-driven content

## Success Metrics
- ‚úÖ Real-time collaborative editing working
- ‚úÖ AI contribution valuation accuracy >80%
- ‚úÖ Micropayment distribution <1 second latency
- ‚úÖ 100+ active collaborative documents
- ‚úÖ Average contributor earnings >$5/month
- ‚úÖ Academic institution partnerships

## Timeline & Phases
- **Phase 1** (Weeks 1-2): Collaborative infrastructure
- **Phase 2** (Weeks 3-4): AI valuation system  
- **Phase 3** (Weeks 5-6): Payment automation
- **Phase 4** (Weeks 7-8): Public collaboration launch

**Priority**: üü† High (Revolutionary feature)  
**Bounty**: 0.8% (Paradigm shift in collaborative writing)  
**Dependencies**: Enhanced document persistence, BSV protocol integration

---
*MAIP transforms Bitcoin Marketing from a document editor into a collaborative knowledge creation platform, creating new economic models for content creation.*

title: üî¥ Enhance Document Persistence - Users Cannot Access Published Documents on Re-login
body:
## Problem Statement
Currently, users cannot see their published documents when they log back into Bitcoin Marketing. Published documents are not persisted in a way that allows retrieval across sessions.

## Current Behavior
- ‚úÖ Documents saved locally work fine
- ‚ùå Documents published to blockchain disappear on re-login
- ‚ùå No document library showing blockchain documents
- ‚ùå Cross-device access not possible

## Expected Behavior
- Users should see all their documents (local + blockchain) on login
- Documents should persist across devices
- Clear indicators showing storage location (local vs blockchain)

## Implementation Status
**‚úÖ COMPLETED** - Enhanced document retrieval system implemented:

### Changes Made:
1. **Enhanced `BlockchainDocumentService.getDocuments()`**:
   - Now loads from multiple sources (metadata + published docs)
   - Merges and deduplicates documents
   - Sorts by updated date

2. **Added `storePublishedDocument()` method**:
   - Persists documents across sessions
   - Stores decrypted content for easy access
   - Prevents storage bloat (max 100 docs)

3. **Auto-sync on login**:
   - `syncUserDocuments()` called on service initialization
   - Emits sync events for UI updates
   - Future-ready for blockchain querying

4. **Enhanced UI indicators**:
   - Updated storage icons (‚õìÔ∏è blockchain, üíæ local, üîó hashed)
   - DocumentSidebar listens for sync events
   - Better visual distinction between sources

## Technical Details
- Documents stored in `published_docs_${userHandle}` localStorage key
- Automatic persistence when publishing via `storePublishedDocument()`
- Backwards compatible with existing documents
- Ready for future D:// protocol integration

## Testing
- [x] Publish document ‚Üí logout ‚Üí login ‚Üí document still visible
- [x] Multiple documents persist correctly
- [x] Icons show correct storage method
- [x] Sync events trigger UI refresh

## Next Steps
1. Add blockchain querying (D:// protocol) for true decentralization
2. Implement cross-device sync via blockchain indexing
3. Add conflict resolution for local vs blockchain versions

**Priority**: üî¥ Critical (Core functionality)  
**Bounty**: 0.3% (High impact on user experience)

---
*This resolves the core issue preventing users from accessing their published work.*
